mods_rules.rule: The root mods element is mandatory and must include version="3.8".
At least one top-level element is required (typically titleInfo).
Include titleInfo with at least a title element for every document.
Use name elements with appropriate type attributes (personal, corporate, conference, family).
Include role information for names using roleTerm elements.
Specify typeOfResource to indicate the nature of the content (typically "text").
Use genre to classify the document type (report, guideline, article, etc.).
Include originInfo with publication details when available (publisher, date, place).
Add physicalDescription for format information (PDF, page count, etc.).
Include abstract when a summary or description is available in the document.
Use subject elements for topics and keywords found in or relevant to the document.
Add identifier elements for DOI, URL, or other persistent identifiers.
Specify language using languageTerm with ISO 639-2b codes.
Include recordInfo to document metadata about the MODS record itself.
Make educated inferences when complete information isn't available, but indicate uncertainty in notes.
Extract information conservatively - only include what can be reasonably determined from the document.
For standalone documents, do NOT use relatedItem type="host" or part elements with volume/issue/pages.
Use empty elements or placeholder text like "Unknown" when required information is not available.
